intro: Epilobium × argillaceum, commonly known as the meadow willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the genus Epilobium in the family Onagraceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as along stream banks and in meadows. Epilobium × argillaceum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
